column4: what are the common practices for synchronizing files between laptop and desktop?
is this just syncrhonizing email or what?
synchronising files, such as documents/pictures
i would just go with rsync
or maybe put them on a server and use nfs
hmm.. the problem is that rsync is not two-way
you run it twice then
problem with server is that it requires the laptop to be on network to use those files
it will be sort of a pain, but i don't really know of a great solution
also, cvs/svn/whatever is an option

I think there might be some issues with runnning rsync twice, if you delete files on one of the machines..  besides, I want it to be automatic, so I don't have to run script all the time. I have been thinking about making a script that checks for the presence of the laptop on the network every 5 minutes or so and then syncrhonise if it does.. but I am still in doubt about two-way sync with rsync
it is possible to do two way rsync, but it is sort of complicated because there are a a few weird corner cases to work out
yeah, thats my concern.. the reason I need it to be automatic is because the laptop is my wive's, and she is running windows on it, so it needs to be automatic
particularly for pictures.. because I use my digital cam, and she has cam on her phone, so both of us would add pictures every once in a while, on both systems
i think without a third computer you are going to have to hack together a solution with shell scripts
hmm, was afraid that would be the case, its a shame though that there are no good solutions for this, soo many ppl have primary/secondary computers these days
is ifolder a webdav solution?

not sure, its a server/client solution from novell. You build a server, and then your clients all synchronise to this every once in a while. its open source, but there are no packages for ubuntu at this time..
ok, well if it is what i think it is, it is a lot like using cvs/svn
not really, because the synchronisation is totally automatic
what you do is to set up a folder on server using a config tool, and then point this folder to a local folder.. everything you drop in local folder is automatically synced with that folder on server
and then you share that folder with others..
